question: A substance that is made up of atoms of more than one type is a ____.
Anything that occupies space or has mass is referred to as ____.
The atomic number of an element refers to the number of ____ in the ____ of the atom.
What is the maximum number of electrons that can be in the valence orbital of an atom?
In orbits farther from the nucleus, the energy possessed by the electrons: (a) increases (b) decreases
An electron that has broken loose from its atom is a ____ electron.
The smallest independent portion that a substance can be broken down into and still possess the properties of the substance is a ____.
The smallest portion an element can be broken down into and still possess the properties of that element is referred to as an ____.
